solution.text:
Let a be the first term and r be the common ratio of the G.P.
a=_{p}_
it is known that, \(a_n=ar^{n-1}\)
\(a_2=ar^1=_{p}_r\)
\(_{{p*q}}_=_{p}_r\)
\(r=_{q}_\)
For getting the sum till \(n^{th}\) term)
\(S_n=\frac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r}\)
Substituting given values and solving to get answer
\(S_n=_{{(p*(1-q**r))/(1-q)}}_\)

content.text: Find sum of _{r}_ number of terms of the G.P. _{{p , p*q , p*q**2 }}_.
